website_summaries.verdict: A great choice if you're looking to purchase a single hand gripper that can adjust with you as you grow in strength.
pros: Adjusts to 4 different levels of resistance
Suitable for large and small hands
Easy to adjust if you follow the instructions
Quiet hand gripper that won't squeak

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, needs easier settings for small framed girls
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product, good quality. Being a small-framed woman, the easiest setting is a little too difficult for me. I had hoped there would be an easier setting so that I could gradually build up strength. My main purpose for this purchase was the research behind using hand grips to lower blood pressure. It requires a 2-minute hold, but two minutes on the easiest setting is too much for me. There should be a couple of extra settings on this so that people can work their way up to a greater strength. As a modification, I am holding the grips partially engaged instead of fully engaged. I don't know if this will give me the same benefits.
customer_reviews.author: M Cook

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material - does not work
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't going to post a review until I got spammed for the fifth time by the seller via email. I opened this item fresh out of the box, followed the instructions exactly as written, and it doesn't work at all. You can spin the wheel infinitely in either direction and it doesn't adjust the resistance or the location of the screw on the vertical axis. I could tell right when I opened the item that it was made with very cheap material.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Catastrophic failure!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hand strengthener for 5-6 months at my desk at work with regularity. All was well until I experimented with using the highest difficulty setting, and the device promptly shattered in my hands. With the high tension, pieces shot all around my desk, and could have easily injured myself or my coworkers. This sounds like an exaggeration, but it is not. The plastic's strength is simply not suited for the tension load of the spring. Simply, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Steinle

customer_reviews.title: Had a couple issues but it’s too late to return them.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found my old hand grippers. These have very slippery handles. I put the white cloth like medical tape to help the traction on the hand grips. It would be better with the black cloth plumbing tape but thought it might get messy. Then they developed a squeak, then it kept getting worse till I sprayed a lubricant on underside where the mechanism is. It helped a little but I stopped using them. They had fairly good tension. Solve those two problem and they’re good.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T.

customer_reviews.title: Can pinch skin
customer_reviews.text: See picture above. These grippers can pinch your skin. It's already happened to me once. Also, the material used for the hand grips themselves is slippery. Once you apply pressure your fingers slip around the grip so the action isn't as beneficial as if it were non-slip. Also, it is very difficult to exercise using just the ends of your fingers; they slip off when you squeeze. I have wrapped the handles with gaffers tape to make them non slip. Now the device works well but there's still the danger of getting skin pinched by the "stoppers" (circled in the picture) which are not needed on a grip strengthener.
customer_reviews.author: DanC

customer_reviews.title: Effective but slippery with a pinch point
customer_reviews.text: The Strengthener appears to be well built and effective. Strangely, though, for a device designed to be manipulated by hand the plastic is amazingly slippery so there is a tendency for it to move in the hand during exercise. I haven't had it slide out of my hand, but it always feels as if might. Also be careful of a pinch-point where the two handles come closest together, just below the spring. It got me once. I am more cautious, now.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Love the grip
customer_reviews.text: I like this product very much. It is like grabbing a spray bottle top. Feels very natural. Like the compression technique of this product over the other styles out there. Well made. Came on time. Quality. Very pleased. Senior citizen (64 yrs old). My grip was starting to go. Harder to open jars. Now I can sit in my chair, watch a movie and get in some grip and forearm workouts!
customer_reviews.author: A. Berthelot

customer_reviews.title: Ups and downs
customer_reviews.text: As others have said here, the grip can be slippery. I have dry hands so I don't find it a problem; if it starts to slip just wash your hands. The adjustment process takes some getting used to, but it's fairly simple. Pros: the grip angle and resistance are perfect. After a few months I've been increasing the resistance step by step, and getting great results. Jar lids fear me now. My biggest problem has been the hinge pin (see photo). As the gripper is used, the steel pin slowly slides out. After a few days I have to push it back with heavy pliers. Nothing I've tried will get it to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: bridgecross

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise for fingers, grip and forearms!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this product I wanted to exercise my forearm. This is exactly what I got. Firstly, the colors between the picture and product are actually switched. It has different levels of strength so adjust accordingly. The first level is 22 lbs, second is 37 lbs, the third 55 and the fourth is 70 lbs. I have only used the first two but I have noticed an increase in strength after a while. At first, it put work into my fingers. I did not know my fingers were that weak! But after a while, you'll notice it on the grip and forearms. It's just what I wanted. Highly recommend it! Also, the size was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in April. I am a woman over 65 years old so it's not like I was a heavy user. It has already quit staying in two of the adjustment spaces. I found it does not work my hands nearly as well as a soft ball does.
customer_reviews.author: MabelLucy

customer_reviews.title: Best hand exerciser I have used
customer_reviews.text: As a handgun enthusiast, I have used a variety of different hand exercisers over the past two decades from the helical spring type to elastomer rings. This is the best one I have used. It is comfortable, sturdy, and most importantly adjustable for different resistance levels. I would recommend it for anyone who plays a sport where grip strength is important as well as for people who are rehabilitating after a hand injury.
customer_reviews.author: Pygar

customer_reviews.title: Be careful! It bites
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a very good addition to one's collection of self-improvement tools. BUT, it has one glaring fault that caused me to give it one star instead of five. If you are not very careful, you can pinch the skin of you hand between the moving parts. I am sure that a little engineering improvement can make this the quality instrument that it was intended to be. Let's hope so.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great device--Real, measurable gains in only a few weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Generally, when I've tried devices like this before they haven't made much of a difference. They either offer too little resistance from the get-go or, even if they do, my body quickly adapts and I don't see much benefit. This one, on the other hand, is a different story--steady use throughout the day over six weeks has made a huge difference in my grip strength, and also paid dividends in other exercises at the gym where my forearms were limiting what I could get the primary muscle groups to do. I liked it so much I bought a second one to keep at my desk at work as well.
customer_reviews.author: sacrebleu

customer_reviews.title: They are great that they are adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I have given a number of these out as gifts. They are great that they are adjustable, so if someone is trying to build strength or recover after a injury the tool is flexible to grow with their strength. I find hand strengtheners are a good way to fight off sleepiness. On longer drives or sitting at the work computer all day, doing something physically deliberate seems to help.
customer_reviews.author: S. Riniker

customer_reviews.title: Innovative upgrade on traditional hand grip strengtheners
customer_reviews.text: Very positive experience with this product; works great with lots of adjustable settings. It's also quiet compared to other devices like it. The only possible drawback is that adjusting the range of motion on it also adjusts adjusts the resistance. It doesn't really affect me, but I could imagine some people might ideally want a large range of motion with the ability to decrease resistance. But at this price point, you can't complain. And it's very easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: D. Story

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice grip exerciser. It's got a good feel and weight, I've been using it off and on for a year now and it appears as sturdy now as it did the day that I got it. I like that it's adjustable and I like the price. My one quip is that I don't care for the hard plastic grip when doing numerous repetitions - I think I'd like a slightly softer grip, perhaps with some texture. I think that the softer grip would affect longevity so it's probably a bit of a give and take in the grand spectrum of things, but it's something to consider while making your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J.

customer_reviews.title: A Well Designed Hand Grip Strenghtner
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well designed hand-grip-strengthener. The tension is easily and quickly can be adjusted to any of the four levels. Also, it appears to fit well in small or large hands. It looks to be very durable too. it feels very safe since the spring is compressed rather than stretched during the exercise. I don't like any exercise equipment which the tension is created by stretching a spring or a band rather than compressing. I am afraid of breakage during exercise. So, I would definitely recommend this to any friend or family member. It is a very useful exercise piece for fingers and forearms. Scott
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works and can be adjusted but needs grip tape around the handles...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grip strengthener because I needed to improve my pistol grip and other grip strengtheners I own don't offer enough resistance to do the work. It is well made and works well but I had to use some grip tape around the handles because they are slippery.
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent to gain back your hand strength
customer_reviews.text: Has different settings for different levels of resistance. Very useful to build up your strength after an injury. I started using it on its lightest setting and I am now on a much higher setting. Its serving me well to get back my hand grip pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Barely matches the specefications
customer_reviews.text: I bought this consideraing the fact i have the option to adjust weight upto 40lb but this is more like a kids toy not for a real hand grip strengthener.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty Wins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but SQUEAKY!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this grip strengthener. It's build super durable, and I really like how you can adjust the resistance. However, I got this to use at work and I was bummed when it came in the mail to find that it squeaks every time you pump it!! It's definitely not for a quite work place, and even at home it got really annoying just using it... Anyone have any suggestions how to make it not squeak??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable for mild use to super heavy duty use..
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good.I've been working out since early teens,so i am pretty muscular.I have the "Claw",and 2 different sets of hand grips.The heavy duty plastic kind and wooden handled extra heavy duty grips.I was considering the all metal grips,which are for super heavy dutyuse ,but i decided to try these Flawness Fitness adjustable tension grips.I have them set at the lower hole and have turned the dial all it can go.These grips are for strong people like myself .I get a hand,wrist ,forearm workout ,and i even see my triceps being toned.I would recommend these grips for anyone who needs a good hand/wrist strenthener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: Update. I took a rasp file to the handles to rough it up a little. Much better. No longer slippery. It's a good product, but the orange handle is VERY slippery. It's very hard to get a good grip on it when squeezing it. I would suggest some dimples molded into it or add some grip tape.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: The first product I received was/is a perfect 5 Star piece of equipment without any flaws. I loved it so much, I ordered one for my brother from the exact same seller. Unfortunately, the one I ordered for my brother looked and felt like a very cheap knockoff . Even the colors of the grips (orange/black) were reversed and the adjustment wheel did not work at all. It was a very disappointing piece of garbage that I promptly returned. My original one is still a 5 star product but buyer beware ... will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: I guess I expected more as this is the highest selling and best reviewed grip strengthener on Amazon, but it has a few drawbacks. The first is the plastic mold seam on the finger grip area is very annoying and can be uncomfortable after using for more than a few minutes. The second is the squeaking on the lightest and second-lightest weight settings - I lubed the spring and bushing with gun oil and it only reduced it to a smaller yet more high pitched squeak. As a tool that serves one purpose, those 2 drawbacks make it a very mediocre piece of equipment. Overall it does the job but I would look at other options available.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Stone

customer_reviews.title: It is a quality unit and I was very happy with it from the first sight
customer_reviews.text: I shoot firearms, especially 9mm, and I purchased this to strengthen my hands and wrists. It is a quality unit and I was very happy with it from the first sight. While I am watching the boob tube I work with this. The only thing I found wrong is that the bottom handle <orange> is a little slippery but was easily corrected with a small piece of skateboard tape which I had on hand for my gun grips. I will still give it 5 stars for the quality of the product and the follow up of the group to see if I was satisfied. Ampete
customer_reviews.author: ampete

customer_reviews.title: Well made, adjustable intensity levels and easy to use while watching TV
customer_reviews.text: Fits an average person's hand. I like that it is adjustable and the intensity level can be increased as your hands get stronger. The instructions are clear but you do have to fiddle with it when you try to increase the intensity setting. I have arthritis and this strengthener helps to make my hands stronger. However, due to the arthritis, I need to wear gym gloves to provide additional padding. Younger people won't have this problem. This strengthener is a good place to start and very suitable for most people. But once I exceed the highest intensity setting of this strengthener, I plan to order an even stronger model.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Sierra Madre

customer_reviews.title: Noticeably STRONGER Grip & Handshake After 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help strengthen my grip so I could do more pull-ups without my hands slipping off. PROs: (1) It works. After using for a couple of months my handshake is noticeably stronger and my grip is way stronger. (2) Unlike other reviews, my hands aren't slippery/wet/moist/etc, they are dry by nature so I didn't need to add tape to avoid slipping on the gripper. CONs: (1) Changing the tension is a little awkward because when you change weight settings you can't tell if it's in place or will pop out.
customer_reviews.author: NPM

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best product like this currently on the market. I have had other models but never one with adjustable settings, it is very convenient. My only gripes are mostly personal issues. I have hand problems, so the plastic grip can cause me some pain, but for anyone else this shouldn't be a problem. Also, the instructions for adjusting the strength were sent to me by email a couple days after receiving the product and as far as I am aware not with the original package, which I I I believe should be changed. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Blake Becker

customer_reviews.title: adjustable hand grip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. Here's what he had to say about it. "I love this product. I have bought numerous hand grips over the years but they either were too easy for my strength level or too difficult. This hand grip strengthener allows you to progress through 4 different level of strength. It is easily adjustable and I understood the instructions after reading them one time. The grip strengthener is solidly designed and I have not seen any flaws with its construction. Great product and quick delivery."
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability is big positive
customer_reviews.text: Adjustability is a positive but somwhat difficult. Don't get your hand in the wrong position or you will pinch the skin between the thumb and finger. Much better than the he-man strength required for otheers
customer_reviews.author: Pritch

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive exercise tool. I was looking for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive exercise tool. I was looking for a hand grip strengthener that offers more resistance than the typical $2 A-frame models you see everywhere. I didn't expect the flexibility of adjustment that this model offers. " The first hole marks 22lbs of force, 2nd is 37lbs, 3rd is 55lbs and the 4th hole is 70lbs. " 1st position equates to those typical grip exercisers mentioned above. I knock a star off for the actual grip being somewhat slippery - the inscribed grip patterns aren't enough, I may put some grip-tape on it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Buchter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Grip & Forearm Strengthener
customer_reviews.text: Perfect grip and forearm strengthener. Very well made. I got mine to help alleviate a bit of arthritis I was experiencing in my right hand. My doctor recommended a bit of exercise versus medication. So far so good . . . getting better and stronger at the same time. Also, the seller followed up with additional instructions for usage. Nice touch." . . . bgs.
customer_reviews.author: Bob GlickSmith

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it for increasing grip strength and for hand and wrist health. See reason for 4-stars (not because of product).
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hand gripper for people who just want to exercise their forearms and for beginners you want to increase their grip strength and forearm size. It was a great way for me to get back my grip strength and now I can use heavier/stronger grippers and I only used it for a little over a week. The quality of the gripper is sturdy and not cheap. I would recommend everyone have one of these since it helps your hands as well and is not a costly investment. I would give it 5 stars, but the seller kept asking me to write a review and I found that annoying.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher who likes to build things and work on my car occasionally. You don't use grip or finger strength often while teaching. I noticed I was getting weaker in that area. It made my tinkering a lot harder. I bought this and use it in the car on the way to work. It's adjustability is fantastic. I can already tell it's making a difference. I can use it literally anywhere. Unfortunately, I can tell I will eventually outgrow it. I'm already using the highest setting. It would be great if there was a way to change out the spring for a stronger one. Maybe there already is!
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Resistance
customer_reviews.text: I work a lot with my hands so I was on the fence on this vs. another that advertised more resistance. This is more than enough for me. It does squeak a tad and adding some grease didnt seem to help much but I can accept that. I like the grip on it and adjustable width.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaScott

customer_reviews.title: Blackanddecker? Great product. Well made. Four resistance settings to choose from.
customer_reviews.text: I threw away the box before I read the directions, so I didnt quite know how to adjust it. Only took me a few minutes to figure out that you had to loosen it to move the fulcrum to the different notches. I originally thought it had infinitely adjustable resistance via the screw. So in reality it has 4 positions to choose from. One is totally flimsy. Two is a warm up. Three is what I am currently working with. Four is what I strive to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 4

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works great
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Hand Grip Strengthener for a few days now. I found it intuitive easy to adjust the resistance. I'm purchased the product to help me regain some strength in my forearms and my grip. I have been dealing with some elbow tendinitis and I am using the grip strengthener to regain what I lost while recovering and resting my elbow. So far I love it. It's a sturdy product and I like the resistance settings. It fits my hand good and the grip doesn't dig into my palm like some others I have tried. I would recommend your product to people.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Grab something else
customer_reviews.text: Terrible grip is far from being non slip and adjustment must be very careful when changing tension as the lock in is less then positive and after taking to weights and measures the tension is far from close. IMO a tennis ball would be a better investment.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Walker

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip!
customer_reviews.text: This product is well constructed and works pretty much as expected. Resistance is easily adjustable and it is easy to find the right level. The only drawback is that because it works on a fulcrum principle, the higher the resistance level, the shorter the range of motion. This may not be an issue for most users, but for me, I started on the second highest level and it was a bit limited. However, this is generally a good product and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: CTSO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grip strengthener with adjustable resistance, great value.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because of its adjustable grip. I had a cheap everlast, which worked fine, but started creaking, etc., and only had one resistance level. This product I felt was nice as you could use lower resistance and a lot of reps, or higher resistance and less reps. That's exactly how it works and it has four levels of resistance. I mostly use it on the highest, but can adjust if I want to. I would say 90% highest, 10% on the next two lower resistances. It seems well constructed. As far as size, it fits my hands perfectly. I would say I have average size hands for a male.
customer_reviews.author: ZQubed

customer_reviews.title: Great, but apparently I didn't need it.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this, alongside a 55-154lb gripper to improve my grip strength as I always felt like my grip was weak. Unfortunately, even at the highest setting, this was too easy. Gave it to my wife, and she loves it. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymouss

customer_reviews.title: Just what I've been searching for for quite a while
customer_reviews.text: Just what I have been searching for quite a while, I have two, one for each car. My hobby is motorcycle Motor Officer competition that involves hours of clutch operation with my left hand. I've tried everything, tennis balls and many other types of hand exercisers. This one is different because it allows the user to very quickly adjust the resistance from approximately 25 pounds all the way up to approximately 75. It's small enough and light enough to stick in a coat pocket or take with you in the car. Well done, a great design!
customer_reviews.author: WMS

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke after about 3 uses. Manufacture didn't want to replace. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I like this product because of the multiple settings for weight adjustment ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because the multiple settings for weight adjustment help forearm progression. I personally don't like how the strengthener looks, and I prefer products with the foam around the handles. However, this product will get the job done and doing 10+ reps on the highest setting is quite a workout.I recommend for anyone who's looking for a way to work their forearm muscles and grip strength!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Silver

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I like its ability to be adjust. However the The front portion of the grip, where you put your four fingers, is extremely slippery. The surface is entirely smooth. It would be nice to have something for grip on it like the back handle does. As it is the device wants to slip sideways in my hand while using it.
customer_reviews.author: James Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I broke my finger and due to limited use my hand became stiff. This has been a good rehab tool. I like that it has different intensity levels and adjusts easily. I carry it in my lunch box and use it whenever I get a moment.
customer_reviews.author: HA!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I use this at my office desk. I went straight to the 70 pound setting. Solid construction. Easy to adjust. The company has a lot of follow through with email and I appreciate that. Seems like they'll back up their product if there are any issues. I'd say buy with confidence, as this was very affordable, and you get what you expect from it.
customer_reviews.author: ten speed

customer_reviews.title: It's OK, but...
customer_reviews.text: I personally found the ergonomics to me a little poor. The finger grips were too small for my large hands and the back handle has a tendency to slip off your palm. The build quality is ok and it might work well for someone with smaller hands. I purchased the GD Grip Pro instead; it had far better in build quality, better ergonomics and had infinite adjustability rather than just 4 settings. It was more than twice the price, but totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: EMH

customer_reviews.title: Helps my arthritis
customer_reviews.text: This has really helped my hands gain strength. I have arthritis in my hands and a friend told me that this would help. I kind of think it has
customer_reviews.author: K Michel

customer_reviews.title: Update: bummer, it squeaks loudly every time you squeeze it. [Nice, works as advertised].
customer_reviews.text: Update: the thing squeaks. I noticed the little pin holding one of the handles works itself out. If you tap it back in, the squeaking stops, but then it just works itself out again and the squeaking resumes. This is easy to adjust and works well. Don't start a thumb war with me now!
customer_reviews.author: Nakieta

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Seems good so far! The knob at the top is a little bit difficult to loosen/tighten sometimes but if you squeeze the grip a little it should ease up a small amount (this is stated in the manual that comes with it). Not a problem really, it seems like a good product. I haven't used it for more than a few days but I'm happy with the difficulty settings and the quality of the build.
customer_reviews.author: Boat

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first motorcycle recently and found my wrists and forearms are getting sore after every ride from managing the throttle and clutch, so I figured a hand grip strengthener would help me manage that. Great little product, super well built and affordable. Feels great to use. The only problem I have with it is that the palm grip (the black grip) tends to want to slide away from the inside of my palm where it's meant to stay. I'm not sure if it's because the handle isn't grippy enough or if the shape could be tweaked. Perhaps I'm alone in having this problem. Even with that small issue, however, it's a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Pukelele

customer_reviews.title: Broke on my first use!
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this one star because when I adjusted the strength the plastic broke on the side of the black handle. I had shattered plastic pieces pierce my hand (which hurt) and now it is broken. This was my first time using it, so I never got a full squeeze out of it.
customer_reviews.author: D.F.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Good product to use while watching TV - I have been doing twenty a night and adding five each night. I am up to thirty! WOO HOO - but note that I am an older woman and this is quite a feat given my arthritis. You young ones go get one of these and strengthen your hands and wrist!! NO EXCUSES! This works, is inexpensive and you can exercise while watching the boob tube!
customer_reviews.author: Helen M. Sabin

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable to get max burn or max weight.
customer_reviews.text: Made with a strong plastic can drop it. I got large hands and it fits them just fine. I rock climb and this helps when i'm in front of my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Revelle

customer_reviews.title: Improves hand, arm and grip strength
customer_reviews.text: Liked the shorter movement range my old hand grips had a much longer movement range. Found these work better using shorter range and better. Purchased these to improve hand, arm and grip strength. Noticed improvement after 4-5 days of daily usage.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: I'm a retired carpenter and I hate the thought of losing hand strength as I get ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired carpenter and I hate the thought of losing hand strength as I get older. At first I thought this product was too wimpy to help me maintain my grip strength but then I read the follow-up email from Flawless Fitness (men don't read the instructions that come with something so simple do they?) and found out that I wasn't using it properly. The Grip Strengthener is nearly infinitely adjustable, easy to use, and well made. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: InspectorDan

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for my use
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my use. I am unable to work out in the gym anymore so I do what I can at home. These grips not only offer 4 different positions, but they are quiet!!! I work out watching t.v., and my old grips squeal like pigs when I use them, driving my wife crazy. I am a musician and need to keep strong hands to play and these are just the ticket!! Got here fast and work just fine. Good job!! Thanks again, Bill
customer_reviews.author: willycone

customer_reviews.title: easy and intuitive to adjust and really just what I ...
customer_reviews.text: "I received the grip strengthener yesterday and started using it right away. It is clearly of high quality construction, easy and intuitive to adjust and really just what I was looking for. It is an excellent and far superior replacement for another similar product I had been using previously. ."
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Great strengthener
customer_reviews.text: I broke my wrist 6 months ago and developed CRPS, I currently have very limited use of the hand, lots of pain and no strength or grip.. This strengthener is ideal, I can carry it in my pocket and use it whenever I want. I only have about 10lbs of grip (up from zero a month ago) so I can't close the strengthener on its lowest setting yet, but each day sees a little bit more. It is well made, sturdy and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Good for increasing grip strength but wish it had some padding
customer_reviews.text: Good hand strengthener. I use this when sitting on my stationary bike. I adjusted it to the 3rd setting. I use this mainly to strengthen my grib for Jiu Jitsu. Only improvement I would like to see are instructions included with this, I got an Email after it arrived saying how to adjust the tension. Also would like to see some kind of padding on the grips so it's not as hard to hold onto for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: G. Watt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product, Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product and am very happy with it. It is very easy to adjust and provides a good workout. My only regret is that I wished there were rubber grips on the handles. The plastic is sort of slippery and my hands slip a bit when using it for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: RoosterCogburn

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: A good item, love the adjustability of it. I've used several different grip strengtheners in the past and so far this one is the best. My only two changes would be to add more friction to the side that fits into your palm, it tends to slip a little when you hand warms up. I'd also like to see it be a little longer, I have fairly large hands so they don't fit quite right. Of course with more normal sized hands I'm sure it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but with one big flaw (at least for me)
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, I like this product. The 3rd and 4th setting represent good levels of difficulty. The construction is good. It is easy and convenient to use. The big issue is that it gives me blisters on my fingers and makes them hurt and bruise, especially if I use the 4th setting (the most difficult). I'm not sure if this would also happen with other, similar products. I'm going to try to order a competing product with a more padded grip and see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Jesser

customer_reviews.title: Tight Squeeze.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Well designed and crafted. Shipped and arrived in a timely manner. The instructions that ship with the product are printed in 6 point micro-type and virtually unreadable. The Seller did send an e-mail later with the appropriate instructions that were easy to read. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to improve the strength in their grip.
customer_reviews.author: TreadHead

customer_reviews.title: Your Adjustable Hand Grip Strengthener works great. It is simple to use well-made and worth ...
customer_reviews.text: Your Adjustable Hand Grip Strengthener works great. It is simple to use well-made and worth every penny I paid for it. I broke my wrist several months ago & have been doing Physical Therapy. My therapist suggested I purchase some equipment to continue my treatment at home. I picked yours because it had adjustable resistance. I am totally satisfied & would gladly consider other products from your company to add to my regular exercise equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: Device works nicely for hand rehab!
customer_reviews.text: I was told by my physical therapist to purchase a device to work on my hand strength so I purchased this device and I have to say that I'm very pleased with it! The fact you can easily change the force required and vary the workout to your hand is great. Overall, the device is easy to adjust and works great ... couldn't be happier with it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: with a minimum of fuss and expense. If I lose it, I'll buy another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: bdkcu

customer_reviews.title: It Broke
customer_reviews.text: My husband has nerve and muscle loss in his hand, so he was using it for therapy but I guess he has more strength than we realized.
customer_reviews.author: N. Albert

customer_reviews.title: I now have the grip of THOR!
customer_reviews.text: Since I got this my kids call me Popeye. I'm now able to open jars and bottles that have been rusted and painted shut for decades. Yesterday I went on a job interview and when I shook the hands of the hiring manager I accidentally broke his hand with my incredible grip. Use this wisely or you may end up ruining the steering wheel of your car, breaking the handle on the shopping cart at the grocery store or crushing beer bottles accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: TwoWheelsSunset

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: Handle is a bit slippery had to add some grippy tape to be able to hold it. Resistance is nice and. Variable.
customer_reviews.author: KillaKamz

customer_reviews.title: So far I quite like the grip trainer
customer_reviews.text: So far I quite like the grip trainer, it is very sturdy. The only pitfall I give it so far is that the anchor portion concentrated a lot of force at the base of my thumb/palm and that area starts hurting long before my fingers or forearm tire. I am looking to wrap it in some foam or rubber tape to see what that does.
customer_reviews.author: Dkrem

customer_reviews.title: I turned 62 recently and have noticed that my hand strength is not what I'd like it to be
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and adjustable. I turned 62 recently and have noticed that my hand strength is not what I'd like it to be, so it's time to get a bit more exercise to get back in shape. This is perfect for what I needed. This was a good buy. ( One note: although it's not really hard to adjust the resistance level, it does take a bit of effort and a little time. If you have multiple users, you might be well served to buy one for each user.)
customer_reviews.author: Rapscallion

customer_reviews.title: "This hand grip is perfect for me to rehab my broken wrist and hand
customer_reviews.text: "This hand grip is perfect for me to rehab my broken wrist and hand. (total of 12 broken bones) I have been doing 30 reps X 3, three times a day since I got it and I can tell a difference in only three days of use. I went thru six weeks of therapy after the cast was removed (cast was on for 12 weeks) this hand grip is helping more than anything they did or had me do in therapy." Ted Robertson McKinney, Texas
customer_reviews.author: Ted G. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed, Easy To Operate, Variable Hand Trainer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a hand strengthener to improve and equalize the strength in both of my hands. This device is a complete match. The unit is well made. The variable spring system allows users to easily and quickly change between four settings. Switching between setting is simple and quick. The product is well made and the modular parts fit and perform flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. I love that it is adjustable, quiet and has a solid build. I like the fact that it is contoured with the finger grips, the only thing I would change would be to add some padding on it as it does start to get a little uncomfortable after some time. Other than that, its a fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Slip
customer_reviews.text: The grip material is too slippery, when squeezing you have to fight it from rolling flat in your grip
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Workd as expected
customer_reviews.text: Does what I needed. Adjusting the resistance is a little bit tricky but works OK.
customer_reviews.author: James Turner

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, but probably not strong enough for someone who already has a good grip though.
customer_reviews.text: This grip strengthener is of moderate quality. Wouldn't pay this much for it again, but kept it as a stocking stuffer.
customer_reviews.author: nightowl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hand grip...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hand grip. Adjustable feature is great in that it works for me and my sons. Only change I would make would be a little "grippeir" on the fingers, but a little hockey tape on the orange extension more than solves that minor item. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This is very cheap and poorly made. It is so choppy that i cannot even use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Well built. Very nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy adjustability. You can adjust to 4 levels. I started w level one and after few days I am on level 2. It's harder to move from 2-3 though, so I'll take my time. I use it every day at work or home or even when driving, while doing what I normally do. I use it on average of 30-40 minutes each hand daily. I feel that my grip and fingers already stronger. Great well built high quality product. Good job.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use it multiple times a day as a stress reliever with the “side” benefit of strengthening my grip. The handles seem a bit slippery. That said, my experience so far makes me think the slickness helps to maintain a consistent hand position throughout the squeeze ... or I have oily hands. Either way, I keep it on my desk and use it 4-5 times a day for 10-15 repetitions with each hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Craig Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's a great little gizzmo
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little gizzmo. I am using it to rehab a weak arm/grip. I am very pleased with the adjustable pressure. The grips are solid and I get a great workout with it. I'm 65 and its nice to be able to adjust it to something a senior can use, and still have the range for more tension as my grip gets better. Great piece of equipment, well made and perfect for my needs. John
customer_reviews.author: John D. Placek

customer_reviews.title: Good, No Squeeking
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my fiance. He has been working on his grip strength and this is a great tool for when we aren't at the gym. He loves to use this while watching TV and it is quiet so it doesn't bother me. The different strengths are nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that this has multiple settings instead of just one where you'd end up buying 4 different ones as your strength increases. While it is plastic it feels pretty sturdy. The only thing I don't like is the wheel that you use to loosen/tighten so you can change the strength level. It's the only part that feels cheap. It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great portable hand grip strengthener
customer_reviews.text: Three adjustable strength pressures. You have to pull the device apart and then set your preference. The lower you go, the harder the resistance. I use it everyday at work to help with my golfers elbow recovery.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES R. HAINER

customer_reviews.title: It really does help strengthen your forarm, only after ...
customer_reviews.text: It really does help strengthen your forarm, only after a week you'll feel a difference. Whenever my hands are free I'll use the hand grip, mostly at home when watching TV. My only cons are that it some times feel odd to hold it and the adjustment isn't simpler.
customer_reviews.author: VII

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grip trainer to aid me in better grip strength for heavy lifting and also to have a more firm handshake in the business world. So far it works well with the current design but if I were to change something, I would probably add some sort of rubber around the handles so that my hand doesn't shift under the heavier settings while gripping. If Flawless Fitness actually reads these reviews and makes a new model with a better non-stop handle I would love to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Gs4 owner

customer_reviews.title: Strong Hands = Strong...Something
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, it certainly gets the job done. I'm a fairly weak guy, so this grip strengthener's tension scale is perfect for me. My only gripe is the lack of, ironically enough, grip. I would have liked to have had a rubberized handle on the palm side to prevent slipping, but overall, easy to use. I'll be crushing coconuts with my bare hands in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: The adjustment is very easy. Product is sterdy and great strength
customer_reviews.text: I am using it for a week now and it works as expected! The adjustment is very easy. Product is sterdy and great strength. Also it looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: spacecrab

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased overall. A little more range of motion would be perfect for me--maybe 1/4 of an inch. The instructions provided for adjustment were not immediately clear. The Co-Founder of the company actually contacted me for feedback and said they would soon be packaging the gripper with more detailed instructions. The adjustability is a plus. I have a strong grip and still have room to advance.
customer_reviews.author: Bigtitansfan

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip exerciser at a very reasonable cost!
customer_reviews.text: I searched through a number of different hand grip strengtheners and this one appeared to be substantial plus easy to adjust. I found it to be both and can already tell a difference after using it a short time. I keep this with me when I'm reading and walking for bonus exercise. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DL Snell

customer_reviews.title: I really like the product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the product. I use it as 6 times a day. It's very accessible, straight-forward, and has a nice comfortable grip. I've bought another brand of a similar product, but the handles have this very harsh steel grating that can be very abrasive to my hands. This product compared to the other one, is worlds better! Also, if you ever make other hand-grip that goes beyond 70 lbs, I'll buy it as well !
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wasserman/Jon Duoos

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This Grip Strengthener works great! It has a wide range of resistance adjustment and it is very easy to change settings.. I've only had it a few days and can already tell a big difference in both grip strength and finger dexterity. I would certainly buy another if / when the need ever arises!
customer_reviews.author: AZryder

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy forearm workout
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using this product for about a week so I have not seen any results, but I can already tell it is a quality product. I love that adjustable tension settings and it is very easy to adjust between settings. I keep it next to my chair and pick it up throughout the night for a quick and easy forearm workout. If I am on the phone, I pick it up and use it. It is a great way to easily work your forearms throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: SRMJW

customer_reviews.title: but at first I wasn't sure how to adjust the settings easily and then once I figured it out
customer_reviews.text: They kept e-mailing me to write a review, so here I am. So, this product is alright, but at first I wasn't sure how to adjust the settings easily and then once I figured it out, it seemed like it was sticking or getting caught when it expanded. It just felt...cheap. Other than that, it gets the job done and it's alright for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Marie

customer_reviews.title: ahhh
customer_reviews.text: the grips have no friction and the squeeze isn't very good either ....the shark grips I bought 2 years ago are way better but the spring snapped so I tried another brand
customer_reviews.author: derrick bronson

customer_reviews.title: wish it was stiffer
customer_reviews.text: it's a nice tool for building strength in your hands i wish it was a bit stiffer. (that's what she said).
customer_reviews.author: August Will Decay

product_meta.title: Hand Grip Strengthener - Quickly Increase Hand Wrist Finger Forearm Strength With The Best Hand Exerciser - Easy Adjustable Resistance From 22 to 70 Lbs (10-32 Kg) - Perfect for Musicians Athletes and Hand Rehabilitation Exercising
product_meta.description:
INCREASE HAND STRENGTH FAST 

Flawless Fitness Hand Grip Strengthener is Perfect For: 

- People that play sports and are looking to increase their hand, wrist and forearm strength. 
- Guitar, Piano, Violin, Drum and other instrument player that wants to play more effectively and comfortably. 
- Anyone who is recovering from any hand, wrist or forearm injury. Great for rehabilitation. 
- Those required to do physical therapy endurance and strength building exercises. Suffers of arthritis and tendinitis. 
- People looking to increase muscle strength in the hands, fingers, wrist and forearms to fix muscle imbalance and avoid injury. 

Product Features: 

- Easily Adjust Resistance Levels from 22-70 lbs (10-32 kg) 
- Great design and eye catching colors 
- Comfortable Anti-Slip Handles fit any hand size 
- Small enough to into a pocket, purse, backpack or gym bag 
- High quality stainless steel tension springs provide long lasting durability 

Customer Satisfaction is Our Goal: 

We care about your experience with our product and want you to be satisfied. If you are not satisfied in any way with our product, please feel free to return it within 90 days for a full refund. We stand behind our product, if you have any concerns or questions, please don't hesitate to contact us! 

We have a small amount of these hand grips available so Order Yours Today!
feature_bullets: Increase Finger, Hand, Wrist and Forearm Strength Fast, Ideal for Athletes and People that do Rock Climbing, Bodybuilding, Golf, Tennis etc.
Easily Adjustable to 4 Different Levels of Resistance and a High Quality, Longer Lasting Design
Designed to Fit Large and Small Hands, Men and Women, Seniors and Teens
Perfect Hand Exerciser for Musicians such as Drummers, Guitar, Piano and More
Hand Gripper is a Popular Choice for Rehabilitation. People With Arthritis, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Tendonitis, Carpal Tunnel, Tennis Elbow and Those Recovering From a Broken Wrist and Tendon Surgery
